definition: medicine/drug/substance used for a specific purpose (e.g. poisoning, explosion, fermenting)/CL:種|种[zhong3],服[fu4],味[wei4]/to poison

sentences.english: So bring him incense, gold, and myrrh.
sentences.chinese: 給他帶來薰香，金子和沒藥樹脂。

sentences.english: The bisabolol can quickly relieve and prevent diaper rash.
sentences.chinese: 紅沒藥醇能迅速緩減和預防尿布疹等情況。

sentences.english: And they gave him to drink wine mingled with myrrh: but he received it not.
sentences.chinese: 拿沒藥調和的酒給耶穌，他卻不受。

sentences.english: How does collywobbles do, in the time of myrrh?
sentences.chinese: 肚子疼怎麼辦，在沒藥的時間？

sentences.english: The gifts; there are three gifts: gold,frankincense and myrrh.
sentences.chinese: 他們贈送給耶穌黃金，乳香和沒藥。

sentences.english: They are frankincense and myrrh. Both have powerful, pleasant smells.
sentences.chinese: 他們是乳香和沒藥，都具有濃郁的氣味。

sentences.english: I have perfumed my bed with myrrh, aloes, and cinnamon.
sentences.chinese: 我又用沒藥，沉香，桂皮，薰了我的榻。

sentences.english: 23Then they offered him wine mixed with myrrh, but he did not take it.
sentences.chinese: 拿沒藥調和的酒給耶穌，他卻不受。

sentences.english: I have perfumed my bed with myrrh, aloes and cinnamon.
sentences.chinese: 我又用沒藥，沉香，桂皮薰了我的榻。

sentences.english: The anti-inflammatory activities of Bisabolol and Zingiberol are widely recognized in the world .
sentences.chinese: 紅沒藥醇和姜醇的抗炎活性已經逐漸被世界公認。

sentences.english: The fruity notes flow over a blend of amber, vanilla, myrrh and rare balms.
sentences.chinese: 水果調協調琥珀，香草，沒藥和香脂。

sentences.english: Strong myrrh scent with hints of meadowsweet.
sentences.chinese: 強沒藥的氣味與梅多斯威特提示。

sentences.english: In particular, myrrh and frankincense are the most commonly used.
sentences.chinese: 特別是，沒藥和乳香是最常用的。

sentences.english: A bundle of myrrh is my well-beloved unto me; he shall lie all night betwixt my breasts.
sentences.chinese: 我以我的良人爲一袋沒藥，常在我懷中。

definition: liquorice (Sophora flavescens), with roots used in TCM
indigo woad root/root of Isatis tinctoria (used in TCM)
black atractylodes rhizome (dried rhizome of any of several atractylodes species) (TCM)
Chinese foxglove (Rehmannia glutinosa), its rhizome used in TCM
donkey-hide gelatin (used in TCM)/Taiwan pr. [a1 jiao1]
dwarf lilyturf (Ophiopogon japonicus), its tuber used in TCM
